website_summaries.verdict: The unique tent design is highly adjustable and easy to use with both Windows and Mac machines.
pros: Switch on back to toggle between Windows and Mac
cons: Some may find the action of the keys to be too soft, making fast typing difficult

customer_reviews.title: Love the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard splits and tilts. So, long typing sessions are easy on the wrists. The keyboard does not have a number pad. So, more desk space. It works without any hitch with both Linux and Mac. A minor inconvenience is the navigation keys are not in the usual place as on a sprawling keyboard. But this is a non-issue for folks who use the non-navigation keys for navigation. As for the price, it does seem steep compared to Microsoft 4000 Ergonomic Keyboard. However, if it lasts a few years with the moving parts, then its price would be fully recovered with the convenience it offers.
customer_reviews.author: Venkatesh Prasad Ranganath

customer_reviews.title: Not packaged for shipment.
customer_reviews.text: @nd keyboard like this, best I have ever had. Shipped in the box it came in, no shipping box, no knock at the door but there was time to take a PHOTO of it on the porch. It rained on the box enough to keep the box wet until I found it at 2AM the next day. Inside was NOT wet. Thank goodness. Box otherwise in A-1 condition but it was NOT packaged for shipment!~ 5 stars for the product, 5 stars for speed of shipment, 0 stars for no packaging to protect it.
customer_reviews.author: va_lover

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to get used to, but it really helps.
customer_reviews.text: Between term papers and documents for work, I was really starting to suffer from my standard Logitech keyboard. My arms were starting to cramp and spasm from overuse, and I could not keep up with the 2000+ words I needed to write every day. Although it took a while to adjust to the keyboard (with the help of a touch-typing practice software), I am happy to say that it takes MUCH longer to overdo it on the Goldtouch. I do use a wrist cushion, so that is something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved my wrists!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot sing the praises of this keyboard enough. I've had wrist problems on and off for the last five years. Didn't help that the desk at my last job wasn't terribly ergonomic either. Switched jobs, and was given the opportunity to order this baby and within just a couple of weeks, my wrist pain was gone. I loved it so much, I went and bought another just for when I work from home. It takes a day or two to get used to the new position, but I don't think I'll ever go back to a standard layout keyboard again. At least not by choice!
customer_reviews.author: cswadner

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, great for those with bad wrist, carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.text: I have the first version of keyboard for PC only for over 8 years now. Loved it, but it was not fully compatible with Mac and the old keyboard lever broke about 4 years ago. Time to get this new one. So far I like it. This new one uses softer springs, so has a different feel compared to the old one. I prefer the old, more solid feeling resistance when I press a key. The new keyboard is more compatible with my 2017 Macbook.
customer_reviews.author: TLe_the_bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomics are good, keys are too mushy
customer_reviews.text: I bough this to replace a version 1 MS Natural Keyboard that has lasted far longer than I expected. It took a while to get the ergonomics just right, as it is awkward to hold the keyboard at the correct position withe one hand, and close the lever with the other. Once it's set, the ergonomics are great. My only real complaint is the mushy typing experience. There is absolutely no resistance, and I am concerned that the keys, especially the space bar, will last long.
customer_reviews.author: mwsgris

customer_reviews.title: The adjustability it's nice on the arms
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this attached to a MacBook pro when I'm working at the office. The keyboard works flawlessly with OSX and supports all of the keys you would find on an Apple keyboard. That includes multimedia keys. The adjustability it's nice on the arms, wrists and hands. The keys feel good, unexpected for rubber dome keys. Compare well to the feel of mechanical keys. This is my third Goldtouch. I got this new one because it provides better support for Apple Macs. It would be perfection if Goldtouch made one using ALPS style switches.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Watters

customer_reviews.title: I really like this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was having symptoms of carpel tunnel. When I got this keyboard and a vertical mouse, the symptoms went away. The keyboard and mouse allow your hands to be in a more natural position than a flat keyboard or traditional mouse. You may need to try the keyboard in different positions until you find the best one. You can buy a separate number pad, but the num lock and Fn keys temporarily convert some of the letters to numbers. This keyboard is my second one. The first one lasted 9 years before the latch broke and would not hold the keyboard up.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon G

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Effective
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical to purchase this due to some other reviews, but I am not at all disappointed. Yes, the price seems a little high for what it is, but I'd much rather purchase something like this than something cheaper that didn't help. It took me about a day or so to get used to the key placement, but that's usually the case with something new and different. I recommend this for anyone who works on a computer daily and for extended periods of time, especially if you are trying to prevent or trying to manage wrist issues like tendonitis. It's very comfortable and I could feel the difference right away compared to my previous office setup.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is different enough from the standard “ergonomic” keyboards to be worth trying at the price. Could adjust further with small design changes and you’ll find yourself wanting to try more aggressive angles that the keyboard wont accommodate. On a Mac some of the special keys don’t work and there doesn’t appear to be a driver available (you might have some luck with a product like Karibiner but I haven’t tried). I’d prefer that the sizes of the Cmd and Option keys were swapped but it’s not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Far too sensitive, too little separation
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and reasonable keyboard layout. I could not stop getting multiple unplanned keystrokes as the keys are so sensitive. Just getting to the home row gave 2 extra characters. Having the bumps on the letter keys that function as number keys was problematic. Kept missing when aiming for home row. A good and solid product, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: important functions are missing, despite being labeled on keys
customer_reviews.text: I have wasted a lot of time trying to get this keyboard to function as advertised, and it fails. It is supposed to be Mac compatible but is not compatible enough. The volume controls do not work, despite emails back and forth with tech support, following various tech support suggestions, and suggestions on a Mac forum. Keys that control screen brightness are not labeled for that function at all and not identified in the User Manual. An expensive piece of trash. Tech support wants to call it "strange behavior" due to using an Apple computer, as if Apple is the reason for the problem. Nope. The computer is fine, the keyboard is not.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Lichtenstein

customer_reviews.title: Still working fine after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: After four years of near daily use, mine is still working fine. The letters have worn off of several keys, including A,S,D,E,C,I,N, and the period key. I have had other keyboards much longer without this happening. Fortunately I was taught to touch type. I am happy with the adjustability, and the fact that the keyboard remains securely positioned once set. The only shortcoming IMHO is the lack of a numeric keypad - once in a while these are useful. I purchased a separate USB numeric keypad for occasional use, so all's fine here.
customer_reviews.author: ScottChi in NC

customer_reviews.title: Shortcut keys do not work in some applications.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work entirely correctly. Unless I'm missing something, I am not able to use the Ctrl-V, Ctrl-X, Ctrl-C, and Ctrl-Z to copy, paste, cut, and undo, in any applications other than MS Word, Excel, and Powerpoint. So it doesn't work in Web browsers, or in my mail program. I don't know if there is a solution to this, so if someone knows, I"m all ears. Otherwise, if these functions do not work, it's a bad keyboard because I have to use my laptop keyboard to fill in when it's not working.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't manage to set this up in a way that felt comfortable to me
customer_reviews.text: Not for everyone. Coming from a Microsoft Comfort Curve 2000, I couldn't manage to set this up in a way that felt comfortable to me. It was a weird height (specifically, look at that bump at the front) and I wasn't crazy about the key orientation either. I've used other keyboards with a similar bi-split which I did find even more comfortable than my Comfort Curve 2000, but they gradually sloped up from the front, meeting the desk surface, and the keys were just placed in a more natural configuration. Might be more comfortable with a wrist pad, but I don't use wrist pads.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Liebner

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: He started typing too much and it screwed up his forearm so he decided to try this out. He really loves it and says it wasn't as hard to get used to. He has even taken it into conference meetings to use with his laptop and it hooks up easily.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Chose this Keyboard after a lot of research
customer_reviews.text: I have carpel tunnel syndrome in both arms after never using ergonomic keyboards. I did a lot of research and decided to buy one with the most flexibility in being able to configure the keyboard so that I could change it as I got used to it. It works really well and I like that it has an extra delete key on the left side. It didn't take long to get used to it and this plus an Evoluent vertical mouse has made a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Saved my wrists
customer_reviews.text: My laptop keyboard was killing me. I had an ergonomic keyboard years ago, but it got lost in a move somehow (or maybe it is in a box of abandoned electronics in the garage somewhere, who knows) and I began to just use my laptop keyboard. Last fall, I started writing a lot. By January, I couldn't write for long without having to stop because of the pain, so I started looking at ergonomic keyboards again. I bought this one. It didn't take long to get used to it, thankfully! I would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Laura W-A

customer_reviews.title: best, most comfortable keyboard ever
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - very comfortable. It can be adjusted to keep your arms and wrist in the proper position - improved typing: Never had actual typing instructions, so I picked up a few bad habits along the way. I didn't realize that I was using my right pointer finger to press 'v'. The split keyboard forces each hand to stay in their own corners. - works with a Mac! Cons: - noisy: while I love the tactile feedback, I can hear the clackety-clack of keys - expensive: friends noted that the keyboard costs as much as a few sacks for rice
customer_reviews.author: ilovepasta

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one - I wore the first one out. This keyboard is so ergonomically friendly as it can be adjusted to fit any need. I had my first one for 3 years and I only had to purchase a second one as someone dropped their drink on my first one and some of the keys just wouldn't unstick after drying it out. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this is the amount of variability in how you position it. It's not just a "position 1 or 2" thing, you can totally customize it to your needs. I had one at work and now I have one at home. I'd give it 5 stars if it had a 10-key on the right, but it doesn't so it gets 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Birgibit

customer_reviews.title: and not at all like a ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It has the feel of a $15 keyboard split into two halves, and not at all like a ergonomic keyboard. The split and tilt makes it harder to type on. I much prefer the Kinesis Advantage keyboard, which takes a few weeks to get acclimated to -- but after that is just superb.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: best ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: this is the best ergonomic keyboard on the market with reasonable price. it reduces my wrist pain dramatically. If you have wrist pain, thumb pain, I would highly recommend to buy this keyboard. It is easy to adjust the heights and angles to your needs.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard - worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is extremely easy to get used to. The keys have a good feel - not too light or too heavy - and the split keyboard is absolutely perfect for comfort. I like the adjustable angle and adjustable tilt, which allows you to get used to the split and the negative angle in small stages. The layout of the regular typing keys is standard, but the number pad has been integrated into the letter keyboard so that the keys can be properly spread out to reduce cramp and typing strain. I have had the keyboard for exactly 1 hour and can already see that it was absolutely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: I mostly love the product
customer_reviews.text: I mostly love the product. The keys are very easy to strike which is good for my carpal tunnel. Some of the key placements are less than ideal. I had an old Lexmark keyboard that was similar to this but Lexmark was smarter in that they built in foldable feet to allow the user to tent the keyboard in several ways and several degrees. Kinesis should have done this and made the product much more versatile without creating a separate ridculously priced ($28+) add on product to allow elevated tenting of the keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: mjm

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard....much more space between the keys. I keep it all flat, myself. Only negative is that the keys (numbers and letters) will wear off in a year just a little bit if you use Purell or cream on your hands at all (which most do) They do sell replacement keys. Seems only the M and N key rub off for some reason. But well worth getting this keyboard...found best one out there!
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Eases tension, more flexibility would be nice
customer_reviews.text: I immediately felt relief from not having to twist my palms so much. It would be great if the keyboard could sit a bit more upright.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for me. It fits in the space I have for a keyboard for my iMac, and is adjustable for the ultimate wrist comfort. The best there is. This is my second one. The first, I had for about 10 years and it got very well used until the letters wore off the keys. My husband looks at the keyboard when he types on this computer, and got frustrated because he couldn't see the letters, so I decided to get another one. We both love it.
customer_reviews.author: Hpycmpr

customer_reviews.title: No longer have wrist pain from using my old, normal keyboard for work
customer_reviews.text: I was able to pick one up for about 40 dollars open box. I needed a new keyboard for work after I realized the one I've been using was the cause of my wrist pain. It took a bit to find a comfortable angle of adjustment, but it's perfect now.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Borges

customer_reviews.title: it's comfortable and it seems to last longer
customer_reviews.text: I was forced to switch to this type of keyboard for health/ergonomic reasons. I believe this is my 3rd brand since 2006. This is more bang for the buck, in my experience. It was less expensive than the others, it's comfortable and it seems to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard didn't lock into place when in tented position. Also, the keys were so stiff that it caused me to get wrist pain. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Garcia

customer_reviews.title: revolutionary !
customer_reviews.text: quiet, ergonomically useful. i have used one of these for years and this is the new version that makes less clacking noise. the angle and split can be varied...there are lots of options. works for both pc and mac with a switch i also use swiveling desk mounted arm rests and really type lightly so am kind of spoiled...you will have to find what works best for you. this model keyboard saved my husband who had repetitive motion injuries from his old computer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Softest key touch ever, perfect for alleviating repetitive stress injury
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I specifically bought this product because it mentioned a soft key touch and I have suffered for years from a repetitive stress injury that is easily irritated when I need to use pressure to push the keys. This product is amazing--it fully lives up to my expectations; light touch does the trick just fine. I actually just bought another one to use in my office because I can't imagine going back to using another keyboard now that I have this. It's little so doesn't take up a ton of space on my desk and it's easily moved around, but most of all it doesn't hurt my arms when I type.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Clunky keys
customer_reviews.text: I love the fully-adjustable tilt and split. I type very quickly and find that the keys are clunky and awkward for my fingers. I've gone back to the Microsoft Curve with its shorter but firm keystrokes. Try this before you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Helps my wrist pain
customer_reviews.text: Worked fabulously for the chronic tendonitis in my right wrist. Keyboard is a little hard to get used to, fingers have to reach further for some keys. Overall - Excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Ducker

customer_reviews.title: Goldtouch adjustable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The versatility of this device is excellent! With bilateral carpal tunnel and chronic neck pain due to instability, I have found that this keyboard has the flexibility to be placed in numerous positions quite easily. I have found the ideal position and can also adjust it for particularly difficult days.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: A finger and hand saver
customer_reviews.text: I can only say this: I don't know how anybody can live without a Goldtouch keyboard. I have been using them for over 10 years and they have saved me from the pain, tingling, numbness, and sometimes agony that people who type all day suffer. I was starting to feel various types of discomfort when I accidentally found out about the previous version of this keyboard (white). No splints, no surgery, none of that. Simply this wonderful keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Hopefully Helpful

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard ever
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I have ever used. Pain in my wrists went away after a few days of use!
customer_reviews.author: NW Friends

customer_reviews.title: Solid ergonomic keyboard for me.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the same keyboard that my employer provides at work while WFH.
customer_reviews.author: M. Saenz

customer_reviews.title: It was my first key board
customer_reviews.text: And I have sentimental feelings for it. Sorta like the first person you went all the way with. If I had it do all over again, I would have picked a white one. When it get a little dark, I have to shine a light to find the keys I don't often use. But I LOVE the way it looks and sounds. And that I can adjust however I want just like a good lover. Betty Dodson
customer_reviews.author: Betty Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as good as it's predecessor.
customer_reviews.text: The v1 was a much better keyboard. This one is better than a flat standard, but not a satisfactory replacement for a hold touch v1.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Sperry

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomics, not quite Apple feel
customer_reviews.text: I find it much more comfortable to type on this keyboard adjusted to maximum split and incline. Instant compatibility w/ my Macbook. Only reservations: •Keyboard feel is a bit mushy compared to Apple keyboards. Not too bad, though. •For Mac users, the option and command keys are reversed. You can fix that easily through the keyboard system preferences, but it still throws me off a bit that the keys are then "mislabeled," even though I don't usually rely on looking.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'm fairly happy with it - it provides a nice change from ...
customer_reviews.text: I added this keyboard to my collection to try and help with RSI symptoms. Overall I'm fairly happy with it - it provides a nice change from my Microsoft Natural Ergonomic 4000 keyboard. That said, there is some limitation to the amount of horizontal and vertical split you can have at the same time - increasing one limits how far you can go with the other. I'd like it if it was able to go further in both directions.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I have an unusual condition affecting the use of my right hand; it's very strangely twisted. MY OT suggested this. It's different to use, and I sure miss the number keypad, but it makes it so much easier to type. There is a number lock - just not as easy to use as the regular number pad. The configuration took some getting used to, but now I just wouldn't go back to my other keyboard, even tho it was an ergonomic board.
customer_reviews.author: Carole G

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately this keyboard made the pain even worse. Especially the pain due to the cubital tunnel ...
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this keyboard I was hoping it would help alleviate my tennis elbow/ cubital tunnel syndrome pain which has kept me from being able to type for long periods of time. Unfortunately this keyboard made the pain even worse. Especially the pain due to the cubital tunnel syndrome.
customer_reviews.author: PSU

customer_reviews.title: pain-free typing!
customer_reviews.text: I had wrist surgery and was unable to type on a regular keyboard. I was so tired of typing one-handed. This keyboard made it possible to type with both hands and now (6 weeks later), it's pain-free (I still can't type on a regular keyboard!). Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: booksfan

customer_reviews.title: Solid hardware....but the keyboard layout should be improved!
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product but the learning curve is really long and hard and is REALLY NOT facilitated by the "shortcut" keys located on the left side of the keyboard. The product would be better and more approchable if the keys were layed out like a standard Mac keyboard, and spaced to minimize the difference of position because of your hands angle.
customer_reviews.author: K&G M.

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great ergonomic keyboard. Purchased this after elbow surgery, so I could accomodate my limited range of motion. Easy to adjust, although 2 hands are better than 1. Good response of the keys, not too much pressure needed but still firm and responsive. Zero problems using with laptop or desktop setups. I'll be keeping this even after therapy!
customer_reviews.author: OregonMom6

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Microsoft Elite ergo keyboard for nearly 10years but was finding it increasingly difficult to get comfortable because, well, I'm not getting any younger. So I ordered the Goldtouch and I love it! Being able to change the width of the keyboard has made a huge difference in my comfort level. The key action took some getting used to but I am having no problems after that adjustment. Definitely recommend this to anyone with wrist/shoulder issues.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Umberger

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use. The tenting didn’t help and the layout was weird
customer_reviews.author: little miss

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product and has held up to daily use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the V1 Goldtouch for a decade. It is a great product and has held up to daily use. The V2 is much lighter and tends to slide around. It also feels fat at the front. Overall it is much more cheaply made. I'm not impressed with the V2.
customer_reviews.author: D.R.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a typist who requires function keys or anything fancy but use my KB through the day. I work from home as a Network Engineer and only needed something to relieve the pain in my wrists and fingers and this KB does help. Its was easy for me to get used to it. I'm hoping it will last a long time, that's my only concern.
customer_reviews.author: mldlylt

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement
customer_reviews.text: Definitely combine it with a fully adjustable keyboard tray, so you can get the keyboard right on your lap, and add a little negative tilt to it. I found it took a couple weeks to fully adapt to the keyboard—had to resolve a few issues in my touch-typing and just get accustomed to the new angle. But I'm typing faster now than ever. And with no pain in my fingers at all! Great. Can't recommend highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: NZL

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has saved me from a LOT of pain when working on my Mac. It allows you to play with the arrangement to find the best fit for you.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Best Ergo Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My wrist and back all the pain is gone and I love this
customer_reviews.author: Cristal Robles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is so flexible it makes getting it just right so easy! People walk by and their like 'what is wrong with your keyboard?!' I laugh and show them how it's ergonomically designed and then everyone wants one! The only negative is that there is no keypad on the right side. Thankfully I don't have to enter numbers too often or that would be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: EKG

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard very much. It's "touch" is excellent. But it's hard to learn to place the fingers where they belong, and it doesn't have the same features my Mac keyboard does.
customer_reviews.author: Anahita

customer_reviews.title: I bought this some time ago
customer_reviews.text: I can't even remember when I bought this but it has to be a couple of years ago. It is not my first Goldtouch. I discovered them when I got one at work, and I love the Goldtouch keyboards. They are gold to touch that is for sure. One of the easiest and best feeling keyboards I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Clow

customer_reviews.title: Some keys are in different places like: home
customer_reviews.text: Some keys are in different places like: home, end, page up, down down etc... this made anything other then typing text difficult and slow. I'm sure I could get used to It if I put the time to get used to the keyboard. Other then the key layout the keyboard feels very nice and I really liked how it splits but I think I'm going to move on to another keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great ergonomic keyboard, very flexible. Only annoyance is when the computer reboots the keyboard automatically defaults to number lock. There are numbers at the top of the keyboard as typical boards do but the letters on this keyboard also have digits so the number lock doesn't lock the top set, it locks the alpha characters with digits. I'm sure it's just a setting that needs to be adjusted but still a bit irritating that it is set up that way.
customer_reviews.author: El

customer_reviews.title: Finally an ergonomic I can use
customer_reviews.text: You can adjust height, the width of the separation...basically any configuration that works for you. I was rehabbing from a broken wrist and torn rotator cuff and this was the only keyboard I could use comfortably
customer_reviews.author: Devilicia

customer_reviews.title: Glad this will work with a Mac!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing to guard against hand/wrist overuse. Light touch. Fully adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this model for the past 10 years. It supports my wrist. Perfect for petit person.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C

customer_reviews.title: very functional and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. I am broad shouldered, and love the split keyboard V shape. Very natural feel, and wonderful tactile feedback from keys. This does the job wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort, needs wrist pads
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard handles very comfortably. It is quite thick though, and as you will fold it upwards as well, additional wrist pads seem mandatory: minimum 2cm / 1in approx. thickness recommended, you may use two mouse wristpads as a low-cost solution. For me as european, I would’ve liked a 105-key version, which doesn’t seem to be available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but i love it.
customer_reviews.text: i've owned about 3-5 of these, i don't remember anymore. but i love it.
customer_reviews.author: L. LE

customer_reviews.title: great ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I spoke with people and did the research on the product. Amazon had the best price even though it said it was used or refurbished. It came and looked new. Using it now and enjoying it. Alleviated the strained feelings off my wrists already. Hope the goodness wil last.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard for freelancers
customer_reviews.text: I work from home, and I use my computer A LOT. This keyword is much more comfortable on my wrists, fingers and arms than a flat keyboard. I've had it for months now, and I haven't had one single issue with it. It's really adjustable; you can set it almost flat or very, very arched like an upside-down V. I highly recommend this for those who sit at their computers for long stretches of time.
customer_reviews.author: a Tennessee kid

customer_reviews.title: good, convenient
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it, good for his wrists. Easy to carry it when he travels.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these I've owned. Really like this keyboard. It allows you to keep your hands in a good ergonomic position, especially if you set the keyboard on your lap.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is good for small hands
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is good for small hands. It is nice that you can adjust the height and span opening. The only slightly annoying thing is, because it is for both mac and pc, some of the pc keyboard commands don't work the way they should. Not sure if it because I am on a parallels windows vm on a macbook or what. But for the most part I can do what I need to do.
customer_reviews.author: SDN

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and weird looking
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me by an ergonomics expert. It took a little getting used to. It's quite comfortable. The only down side is that it is tall when "deployed" so my keyboard tray no longer slides under my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Not really comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Not really comfortable. Push of the keys is uncomfortable. Surface material is unpleasant. The only good thing is = adjustable angle. Otherwise - I'd give this keyboard zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: RK-PaloAlto

customer_reviews.title: Just what the OT ordered
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray was recommended to me by the occupational therapist who did an ergonomic assessment for me. I thought I'd miss the number pad but I don't do as many spreadsheets as I used to. If you type a lot, this is the keyboard you need.
customer_reviews.author: M. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Took some getting used to, but helped alleviate shoulder issues.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S. Sassaman

customer_reviews.title: It's like typing on a sponge
customer_reviews.text: You never know when you actually hit the keys on this keyboard; they don't give provide good tactile feedback. The old Goldtouch keyboards were good in this regard, but the build quality has definitely suffered in this model.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ulrich

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I had been searching for something ergonomic, but not so wide (with number pad) to force my right shoulder to strain moving the mouse. As I don't use the number keys often, I'm happy to use the top row instead. I don't even use the wrist cushions that are also a cool accessory by Goldtouch, as I have good arms on my chair and let the keyboard sit at the desk's edge and my wrists end up in the air, so no stress or pressure.
customer_reviews.author: ALTC Admin

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard would not stay positioned with feet. Kept moving ...
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard would not stay positioned with feet. Kept moving. It is thick and therefore you would definitely need a wrist rest which would be awkward to find one that worked well. I returned this one and got a Kinesis Freestyle instead.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it! uses it for work. She ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it! uses it for work. She was experiencing pain on her wrist, but with this type of keyboard...no more pain!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ergo keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ergo keyboard on the market. You can put its tent shape into any position that is comfortable for your hands. It really relieves shoulder pressure and makes fast typing totally comfortable. I am a fast touch typist and am on my keyboard 6 hours or more a day and this keyboard is wonderful. Service from ergo warehouse is also great. I also have this setup at work and would recommend it to anyone who has experienced pain from typing.
customer_reviews.author: BeABusySheep

customer_reviews.title: fixed my wrists
customer_reviews.text: It does the job of letting me type comfortably without any wrist pain. There are just a few quirks about the functions of certain buttons not matching the labels, and I can't seem to find any software interface with which to remap them to the correct functions.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa E. Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Key Placement is Not Ideal
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the placement of the CTRL keys, it makes it difficult to transition from regular keyboards to this one.
customer_reviews.author: alainadawn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard! I've used Goldtouch in the past and I like this one the best. The touch is softer and the keyboard is quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Book Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Saves my wrists, and doesn't take up a lot of space! It could use a numeric keypad, though...
customer_reviews.author: Blaise Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Found
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I found after looking at dozens of them. Price is right, touch is perfect and the adjustability can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: David Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite keyboards
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I find them easy to get used to and the most flexible for fluctuating between standing and sitting typing situations. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tembrock

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for 2+ years i think, i love it. This has helped my wrists tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: L. LE

customer_reviews.title: good feel, works on Linux and Windows
customer_reviews.text: good for the wrists; provides the option to allow the wrists to rest without strain. Works on Linux OS-Ubuntu 13.10 and Windows 8 and Windows vista.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Preston

customer_reviews.title: Better design than the V1
customer_reviews.text: Better design than the V1. The connecting joint is better reinforced. I have two of these and the joints have already lasted longer than my V1's.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty B.

customer_reviews.title: I've been using these for 7 years already. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for 7 years already. I switched due to RSI, and ever since I haven't had problems (I am also using an ergonomic mouse).
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I have bought, we now have one for the home office and one at the office office. No issues at with this one or the one we bought a year ago!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Paul Shacklock

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.text: I type a lot and my wrists no longer work. It took me awhile to figure out what configuration felt the best. Overall LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Yo Panda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my carpal tunnel at bay. I type all day, and my hands rarely hurt or go numb,
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: make everyone boggle at your keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've had these before and they are perfect for my typing style and do not put undue pressure on my fragile wrists.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ryan Shatford

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard! Work as a medical transcriptionist 8h a day. Love the ergonomics of it. Allows your hands to sit at slanted position. You will never go back to a regular keyboard after this.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This didn't work for me. I really wanted it to. But it aggravated an old hand injury.
customer_reviews.author: FlyingWolf

customer_reviews.title: Key breakdown
customer_reviews.text: The Ctrl key won’t work after only about one month use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I love my GoldTouch!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of data entry at my previous job and this keyboard really reduce the strain on my wrists and hands. The soft key touch feature also provide comfort since I do not have to use extra effort to press the keys. I recently purchase one for my home office. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Flowergemw

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Soft keys. Only keyboard for me. Got 2, one for home and one for work. When I travel, I bring it along. What more can I say?!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my twisted hand. Now able to type without pain.
customer_reviews.author: dremesicle

product_meta.title: Goldtouch GTN-0099 V2 Adjustable Ergonomic Keyboard -- PC Only (USB & PS2)
product_meta.description: Size:Comfort Keyboard + PS2 ConnectionDesigned specifically with individual fit in mind, our Adjustable Comfort Keyboard will find the right comfort position for every member of your office or home.
feature_bullets: Adjusts from 0-30° on the horizontal and vertical planes to properly straighten wrists and achieve a more natural and comfortable position.
Positions your wrists in a neutral or downward position rather than tilted upward.
Soft key touch, low activation force, and full key travel distance.Cable Length: 5 ft 11 inches / 1.8 m<
Provides keying comfort and reduces risk of “bottoming out” when typing.
Plug and play, fully PC Compatible, including both a USB and PS2 connector.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars233 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
